com.conceptwave.scripting
Class History

com.conceptwave.scripting.Object
  com.conceptwave.scripting.History

public class History
extends com.conceptwave.scripting.Object

History class is used to create records in browser history and to maintain Back & Forward browser button actions.

The Application UI is added as a history listener by default with the "onHistoryCallback" method.
Override this method to handle navigation to the previous history tokens or bookmarks.

It is recommended to assign a URL for the Application UI for the correct working of Back&Forward buttons.

The callback method is fired in the following cases:

1) When user clicks Back and Forward buttons in the browser.
It navigates to the previous/next history tokens that were added previously by History.setCurrentHistoryID(historyID, title, data) method.

2) When user navigates Back from the other Application UI to the last history token of the previous Application UI.

3) When user navigates to the page by using a stored bookmark or a link.
In this case the history token might not been added yet within the current application.
To check if the token has been already created, use History.hasHistoryRecord(historyID) method.

Note, when navigating away from the current application, all history record data is getting cleared on the server, although created records still stay in browser history.

Method Summary
static String getCurrentHistoryID()
          Returns current history ID set by History.setCurrentHistoryID() method.
static com.conceptwave.scripting.Object getHistoryData(String historyID)
          Gets user data object currently associated with the history ID.
Note, all records and user data are getting disposed when navigating away from the current application, although browser session might be still the same.
static String getPreviousHistoryID()
          Gets previous history ID.
static com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean hasHistoryRecord(String historyID)
          Returns true if the specified history ID has been added within current application session.
Note, all records are getting disposed when navigating away from the current application, although browser session might be still the same.

          Registers listener for the history callback.
Note, the Application UI is added as history listener by default with the "onHistoryCallback" method.
static void setCurrentHistoryID(String historyID, String title, com.conceptwave.scripting.Object data)
          Sets current history ID.
If the history ID is different from the current one, it will create a new history record in browser.
static void unregisterCallback(Scriptable listener)
          Removes the listener for the history events.

          Removes all listeners that extends the specified metadata object.

registerCallback

public static void registerCallback(Scriptable listener,
                                    String method)
Registers listener for the history callback.
Note, the Application UI is added as history listener by default with the "onHistoryCallback" method.

Parameters:
listener - Any scriptable object
method - Name of the method to call. Method parameters: 1) historyID, String; 2) userData, Object.

setCurrentHistoryID

public static void setCurrentHistoryID(String historyID,
                                       String title,
                                       com.conceptwave.scripting.Object data)
Sets current history ID.
If the history ID is different from the current one, it will create a new history record in browser.

Parameters:
historyID - An unique history ID token.
title - Custom record title. If null, window title will be used.
data - Optional user data object. This object will be associated with the history ID and will be passed i n the callback function when navigating to that history ID in browser.
The data object stored per the current application session and getting disposed when navigating away from the current application.

unregisterCallback

public static void unregisterCallback(Scriptable listener)
Removes the listener for the history events.

Parameters:
listener -

unregisterCallbackByMetadataName

public static void unregisterCallbackByMetadataName(String metadataName)
Removes all listeners that extends the specified metadata object.

Parameters:
metadataName - Name of the metafata object (use '.' only).
